page.title: 01THE SELSFIELD AREA
page.content: This is an area bordered on the north by{Worth}Parish, on the east and south east by{West Hoathly}and on the west and south west by{Balcombe}Parish. The main road, the B.2028, on the east side, from{Selsfield}southwards, was made in Saxon times close to the {Roman road}which had become overgrown. The area is part of a gently undulating lowland flanking the west side of the{Wealden dome,}varying in height between 190m and 108m. It is dissected by the north-south head streams of{Ardingly Brook}and{Cob {Brook}which are tributaries of the {River Ouse.}This is an entirely rural area with cottages, large houses, farms and estates but no main settlement. In the north east {Selsfield Common}is owned by the {National Trust.}Other estates are in private ownership.
